text: "H.A.P.P.Y. Radio" is a 1979 disco song recorded by soul singer Edwin Starr. Starr's previous release, "Contact", had proved to be his best showing on the US Pop Charts (and R&B; Charts) in several years. It was also a huge hit in Britain, making it into the Top Ten and peaking at #6 on the UK Singles Chart. This song was issued as its follow-up, and although less successful, still made all three charts. "H.A.P.P.Y. Radio" peaked at #79 on the Hot 100 and #28 on the R&B; Charts, but was a much bigger hit in the UK, where it was a Top Ten hit (#9) in mid-1979. The song was both written and produced by Edwin Starr himself. ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1979) !Peak position |- |Australia (Kent Music Report) |align="center"|54 |- |United Kingdom (Official Charts Company) |align="center"|6 |- |United States (Billboard Hot 100) |align="center"|79 |} Starr later re-recorded the song as part of Ian Levine's Motorcity Records project, along with many of his previous Ric-Tic and Motown songs.
